data.title: Everything You Need To Know
data.meta_description: Johnny Depp is a well-known actor in the film industry. His filmography spans decades, with credits like Alice in Wonderland (2010), Pirates of the Caribbean series, and Chocolat (2000), to mention a few.
data.text:
Johnny Depp is a well-known actor in the film industry. His filmography spans decades, with credits like Alice in Wonderland (2010), Pirates of the Caribbean series, and Chocolat (2000), to mention a few. Depp’s films have diversified from action/adventure to horror to dramas and romances. In addition, he has directed several box-office hits, collaborated with various directors, and amassed a devoted fan base via movies such as the Pirates of the Caribbean film series.

In this post, we’ll review Depp’s filmography and give you a breakdown of all his films. Then, we’ll be going through his cinematic career year by year, highlighting all of the movies he’s starred in and directed since the 1980s.

Have you ever wondered what Johnny Depp’s movies are all about? Of course, you must have, so keep reading for a rundown of all his films.

As an Actor

1. City of Lies (2021)

Russell Poole, a cop from Los Angeles, spent years trying to solve his most significant case, the murders of The Notorious B.I.G. and Tupac Shakur. Still, the investigation is ongoing after two decades. Jack Jackson, the reporter, determined to defend his reputation and career, is determined to discover the case’s mystery. In their pursuit of the truth, the two form a partnership and uncover a developing web of institutional corruption and deception.

Role: Russell Poole

Director: Brad Furman

Genres: Thriller, Drama, Biography, Mystery, Crime

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Forest Whitaker

Neil Brown Jr.

Dayton Callie

Peter Greene

Movie Trailer: City of Lies

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3PyS72S” watchon=”Amazon”]

2. The Invisible Man (2020)

As a sci-fi thriller, The Invisible Man is about a woman named Cecilia who has an abusive boyfriend. He appears to commit suicide after she abandons him. On the other hand, Cecilia quickly believes that he is still alive and has turned invisible to chase and hunt her.

Director: Leigh Whannell

Genres: Horror, Mystery, Sci-Fi, Thriller

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Elisabeth Moss

Aldis Hodge

Oliver Jackson-Cohen

Harriet Dyer

Movie Trailer: The Invisible Man (2020)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3PxC5Gs” watchon=”Amazon”]

3. Waiting for the Barbarians (2020)

A colonial governor of an unnamed empire experiences a crisis of conscience in an isolated frontier outpost when an army commander arrives looking to interrogate the people about an impending revolt, using brutal tactics that frighten the magistrate.

Role: Colonel Joll

Genres: Drama

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Robert Pattinson

Movie Trailer: Waiting for the Barbarians (2020)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3PB6ynd” watchon=”Amazon”]

4. Richard Says Goodbye (2018)

A college lecturer becomes a rebellious party animal after realizing he has six months to live. To the surprise and delight of his wife and school chancellor, he leads a crusade against authority and hypocrisy.

Director: Wayne Roberts

Genres: Drama, Comedy

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Zoey Deutch

Danny Huston

Siobhan Fallon Hogan

Rosemarie DeWitt

Movie Trailer: Richard Says Goodbye

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3Yyrwac” watchon=”Amazon”]

5. Platoon: Brothers in Arms (2018)

The cast and crew of the Academy Award-winning film Platoon discuss their personal experiences on set, including how a coup d’etat nearly halted the shooting in the Philippines.

Role: As Johnny Dep

Director: Paul Sanchez

Genre: Documentary

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Keith David

Tom Berenger

Kevin Dillon

Willem Dafoe

Charlie Sheen

Brothers In Arms – The Making Of Platoon

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3PxCp88″ watchon=”Amazon”]

6. Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald (2018)

Gellert Grindelwald escapes from captivity while being brought to London and plots a nefarious scheme to establish dominion over Muggles, aided by his true-blood supporters and the youthful obscure Credence Barebone. Meanwhile, Professor Albus Dumbledore persuades his old student, self-proclaimed magic zoologist Newt Scamander, to fly to Paris to save Credence from Grindelwald’s wicked schemes.

Role: Gellert Grindelwald

Director: David Yates

Genres: Adventure, Fantasy, Family

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Jude Law

Eddie Redmayne

Zoë Kravitz

Wolf Roth

Carmen Ejogo

Movie Trailer: Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald (2018)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3V6eDkP” watchon=”Amazon”]

7. Murder on the Orient Express (2017)

After investigating a burglary in Jerusalem, Hercule Poirot becomes engaged in the murder investigation of crooked businessman Edward Ratchett aboard the luxurious Orient Express. However, Poirot is forced to reconsider his idea of justice when natural calamities and devastating disclosures follow.

Role: Ratchett

Director: Kenneth Branagh

Genres: Drama, Mystery, Crime

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Kenneth Branagh

Adam Garcia

Derek Jacobi

Josh Gad

Daisy Ridley

Michelle Pfeiffer

Willem Dafoe

Movie Trailer: Murder on the Orient Express (2017)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3FBd7ld” watchon=”Amazon”]

8. Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales (2017)

Agonized by his bad luck, Jack Sparrow unconsciously releases his avenger, pirate-hunter Salazar, from the Devil’s Triangle. However, Salazar, with his devilish crew, hunts for Sparrow, who joins hands with an astronomer and Henry Turner. Turner is on his mission to search Poseidon’s Trident to liberate his father Will from the Flying Dutchman’s curse. These events meet at a point and guarantee yet another Jack Sparrow sailing on the sea.

Role: Captain Jack Sparrow

Director: Joachim Ronning, Espen Sandberg

Genres: Action, Fantasy, Adventure

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Brenton Thwaites

Kaya Scodelario

Javier Bardem

Orlando Bloom

Keira Knightley

Geoffrey Rush

Movie Trailer: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales (2017)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3Fztyyb” watchon=”Amazon”]

9. The Black Ghiandola (2017)

After his family has been slaughtered in a zombie apocalypse, a young guy risks his life to save the girl he has grown to love.

Role: Nuclear Med Tech

Director: Sam Raimi

Genres: Horror

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

David Lynch

Laura Dern

Richard Chamberlai

J.K. Simmons

Movie Trailer: The Black Ghiandola (2017)

10. Alice Through the Looking Glass (2016)

After three years of wandering across the oceans, Alice returns to Wonderland, where she sees all her old acquaintances save Mad Hatter, who is in tremendous shock due to his lost family. To rescue her loved ones, she must now journey back in time and take the Chronosphere, an artifact that regulates all the time in Wonderland.

Role: Hatter Tarrant Hightopp

Director: James Bobin

Genres: Fantasy, Adventure, Family

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Rhys Ifans

Alan Rickman

Anne Hathaway

Helena Bonham Carter

Mia Wasikowska

Matt Lucas

Stephen Fry

Movie Trailer: Alice Through the Looking Glass (2016)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3FxuenX” watchon=”Amazon”]

11. Donald Trump’s The Art of the Deal: The Movie (2016)

A spoof of the best-selling book The Art of the Deal, the film is a humorous look at Donald Trump’s life, business, and personal success advice. Donald Trump (Johnny Depp) trains people how to bargain and manage the real estate market.

Role: Donald J. Trump

Director: Jeremy Konner

Genres: Comedy

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Patton Oswalt

Christopher Lloyd

Stephen Merchant

Ron Howard

Alfred Molina

Robert Morse

Movie Trailer: Donald Trump’s The Art of the Deal: The Movie (2016)

12. Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016)

Newt Scamander, a wizard and magic zoologist, arrives in New York with a suitcase full of magical animals. However, some creatures escape, and he is accused of working with Gellert Grindelwald, the legendary dark wizard. Newt and Jacob, teamed up with Auror Tina and her sister Queenie, must now track down the escaping monsters and restore order.

Director: David Yates

Genres: Adventure, Family, Fantasy

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Eddie Redmayne

Colin Farrell

Zoë Kravitz

Jon Voight

Sam Redford

Movie Trailer: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3FzIpJ2″ watchon=”Amazon”]

13. Yoga Hosers (2016)

Two yoga-obsessed adolescent females attend a party and are arrested for the murder of a senior. They know they must battle to prove their innocence, but they are up against a Nazi clone army.

Director: Kevin Smith

Genres: Comedy, Horror, Thriller, Fantasy

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Vanessa Paradis

Jason Mewes

Adam Brody

Austin Butler

Natasha Lyonne

Kevin Smith

Tyler Posey

Movie Trailer: Yoga Hosers (2016)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3FYHQtB” watchon=”Amazon”]

14. Black Mass (2015)

F.B.I. agent John Connolly approaches state legislator William Bulger about allying with his brother, crime lord James “Whitey” Bulger, to reduce the dominance of the Italian mafia in Boston. This biographical film portrays how the latter took advantage of this alliance to become one of America’s most notorious crooks.

Role: James ‘Whitey’ Bulger

Director: Scott Cooper

Genres: Drama, Crime, History, Biography

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Kevin Bacon

Benedict Cumberbatch

Dakota Johnson

David Harbour

Corey Stoll

Joel Edgerton

Movie Trailer: Black Mass (2015)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3UZVIIB” watchon=”Amazon”]

15. Mortdecai (2015)

Charismatic Charlie Mortdecai, a British nobleman and part-time unscrupulous art dealer, lacks the finances to support his lifestyle. As a result, when a former college acquaintance who is now an MI5 officer asks him to retrieve a stolen picture, he agrees. However, it soon becomes clear that Charlie is not the only one after the artwork.

Role: Mortdecai

Director: David Koepp

Genres: Action, Mystery, Comedy, Romance, Crime

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Ewan McGregor

Gwyneth Paltrow

Jeff Goldblum

Paul Bettany

Olivia Munn

Movie Trailer: Mortdecai (2015)

Streaming Platform: Prime Video

16. Into the Woods (2014)

Taking inspiration from the Grimm Brothers’ fairy tales, the film begins with a baker and his wife unable to produce a child due to a witch’s spell. However, the witch will lift the curse if they can obtain four artifacts. They meet Cinderella, Red Riding Hood, Jack, Rapunzel, and many monsters along the way, and happy endings are not assured.

Director: Rob Marshall

Genres: Drama, Musical, Comedy, Fantasy, Adventure

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Anna Kendrick

Chris Pine

Emily Blunt

Lucy Punch

Christine Baranski

James Corden

Meryl Streep

Movie Trailer: Into the Woods (2014)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3V7EdpH” watchon=”Amazon”]

17. Transcendence (2014)

Dr. Will Caster is working on creating a sentient computer when he is assassinated by the anti-technology terrorist group R.I.F.T. His wife Evelyn transfers his consciousness into a quantum computer with only a month to live. But, when he begins controlling human brains, Evelyn and his best buddy Max will have to find a method to stop him.

Role: Will Caster

Director: Wally Pfister

Genres: Romance, Drama, Thriller, Sci-Fi, Mystery

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Morgan Freeman

Cillian Murphy

Paul Bettany

Rebecca Hall

Movie Trailer: Transcendence (2014)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3hD062j” watchon=”Amazon”]

18. Tusk (2014)

An arrogant American podcaster flies to Canada to interview a mysterious, reclusive older man with a remarkable past. He ultimately discovers that the old guy is hiding a horrible secret involving a walrus.

Role: Guy Lapointe

Director: Kevin Smith

Genres: Drama, Horror, Comedy

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Justin Long

Haley Joel Osment

Michael Parks

Genesis Rodriguez

Movie Trailer: Tusk (2014)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3V1OWBX” watchon=”Amazon”]

19. Lucky Them (2013)

A comedy-drama about a veteran music journalist who investigates the disappearance of a well-known musician, Matthew Smith. Ellie Klug is trapped in an endless cycle of rock shows, excessive drinking, and one-night encounters with young artists. She is assigned the duty of investigating the story of the influential Matthew Smith, who went missing a decade ago, under pressure from her editor to prove her worth.

Director: Megan Griffiths

Genres: Drama

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Toni Collette

Joanne Woodward

Thomas Haden Church

Oliver Platt

Movie Trailer: Lucky Them (2013)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3FAJroe” watchon=”Amazon”]

20. The Lone Ranger (2013)

An elderly Tonto tells a young admirer the story of John Reid, a lawyer who created The Lone Ranger in 1869. Butch Cavendish, a felon, escapes while being transported by train to the town of Colby. He ambushes and murders John’s brother, Dan, and his men, but Tonto saves John. The two are now working together to apprehend Cavendish and bring him to justice.

Role: Tonto

Director: Gore Verbinski

Genres: Western, Adventure, Action

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Helena Bonham Carter

Armie Hammer

William Fichtner

Tom Wilkinson

Movie Trailer: The Lone Ranger (2013)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3j8HRCn” watchon=”Amazon”]

21. Dark Shadows (2012)

Barnabas Collins, a Collinsport merchant, rejects the romantic advances of Angelique, a witch, and is cursed in the eighteenth century. Everything he cares about, including his fiancée Josette, dies, and he is interred as a ghost. When he evades 200 years later, he should confront Angelique and other evil powers while attempting to save Victoria Winters, Josette’s doppelganger.

Role: Barnabas Collins

Director: Tim Burton

Genres: Comedy, Fantasy, Horror

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Michelle Pfeiffer

Eva Green

Helena Bonham Carter

Christopher Lee

Jackie Earle Haley

Movie Trailer: Dark Shadows (2012)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3j13DYC” watchon=”Amazon”]

22. Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides (2011)

In the fourth installment of the famous Pirates of the Caribbean series, the film follows Captain Jack Sparrow on his quest for the Fountain of Youth. However, he must eventually meet the famed pirate Blackbeard.

Role: Jack Sparrow

Director: Rob Marshall

Genres: Fantasy, Action, Adventure

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Sam Claflin

Ian McShane

Judi Dench

Penelope Cruz

Geoffrey Rush

Kevin McNally

Movie Trailer: Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides (2011)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3BHBlcn” watchon=”Amazon”]

23. Pirates of the Caribbean: Tales of the Code: Wedlocked (2011)

In this short prelude to the first Pirates of the Caribbean film, two feisty brides-to-be learn they share something – the absent groom. Even so, plenty of pirates would gladly sell their goats for them.

Director: James Ward Byrkit

Genres: Fantasy, Action, Adventure, Short

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

John Vickery

Vanessa Branch

Lauren Maher

David Bailie

Movie Trailer: Pirates of the Caribbean: Tales of the Code: Wedlocked (2011)

24. The Rum Diary (2011)

Paul Kemp, an unsuccessful writer, relocates to San Juan, Puerto Rico, to work for a dying newspaper run by crooked editor Lotterman. There he meets the lovely Chenault and Chenault’s fiancé, dishonest realtor Sanderson. Unfortunately, Kemp comes into danger when he finally finds his voice and seeks to expose Sanderson and Lotterman.

Role: Kemp

Director: Bruce Robinson

Genres: Drama, Comedy

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Aaron Eckhart

Amber Heard

Giovanni Ribisi

Michael Rispoli

Richard Jenkins

Movie Trailer: The Rum Diary (2011)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3uW1UXc” watchon=”Amazon”]

25. Alice in Wonderland (2010)

Alice in Wonderland, produced by Walt Disney Pictures, is partially based on Lewis Carroll’s fantasy writings and depicts the narrative of a girl with the power to defeat the Jabberwocky, a dragon-like creature threatening the world. The visual aesthetic and special effects of the picture were lauded.

Role: Mad Hatter

Director: Tim Burton

Genres: Fantasy, Family, Adventure

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Anne Hathaway

Mia Wasikowska

Michael Sheen

Matt Lucas

Stephen Fry

Alan Rickman

Helena Bonham Carter

Movie Trailer: Alice in Wonderland (2010)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3v4dqzP” watchon=”Amazon”]

26. The Tourist (2010)

When Frank Tupelo encounters a lovely woman named Elise on a train to Venice, he dismisses it as an accidental meeting. However, he soon finds himself pursued by Inspector John Acheson and a gangster, Reginald Shaw, who assumes he is the wanted Alexander Pearce with facial reconstruction surgery.

Role: Frank Tupelo

Director: Florian Henckel von Donnersmarck

Genres: Action, Romance, Thriller, Crime

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Angelina Jolie

Timothy Dalton

Paul Bettany

Steven Berkoff

Movie Trailer: The Tourist (2010)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3BDSzHh” watchon=”Amazon”]

27. Public Enemies (2009)

The film circles around the true story of bank robbers John Dillinger, Homer Van Meter, and Baby Face Nelson as F.B.I. agent Melvin Purvis follows them. The film depicts how Dillinger was idolized by the oppressed American populace and the F.B.I.’s efforts to bring the perpetrators to justice.

Role: John Dillinger

Director: Michael Mann

Genres: History, Crime, Drama, Biography, Romance

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Giovanni Ribisi

Marion Cotillard

Channing Tatum

Jason Clarke

Christian Bale

Carey Mulligan

Billy Crudup

Movie Trailer: Public Enemies (2009)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3uZ1n74″ watchon=”Amazon”]

28. The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus (2009)

Set in the present day, this surreal morality tale depicts the narrative of Dr. Parnassus and his ‘Imaginarium,’ a traveling performance in which audience members can choose between light and joy or darkness and gloom. Dr. Parnassus, an avid gambler, gained immortality in a wager with the devil, Mr. Nick, thousands of years ago. Centuries later, after meeting his one true love, Dr. Parnassus struck another bargain with the devil, trading his immortality for youth on the condition that his daughter became Mr. Nick’s property when she reached 16.

Role: Imaginarium Tony 1

Director: Terry Gilliam

Genres: Mystery, Fantasy, Adventure

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Tom Waits

Heath Ledger

Christopher Plummer

Gwendoline Christie

Jude Law

Peter Stormare

Colin Farrell

Movie Trailer: The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus (2009)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3W3V1z3″ watchon=”Amazon”]

29. Pirates of the Caribbean: At World’s End (2007)

Lord Cutler Beckett, who possesses Davy Jones’s heart, employs him to eliminate all pirates, causing nine Pirate Lords to unite the Pieces of Eight to free Goddess Calypso, Jones’s betrayed lover. On the other hand, Will Turner, Elizabeth Swann, and Captain Barbossa must first rescue Jack Sparrow, one of the Pirate Lords imprisoned in Davy Jones’s Locker.

Role: Jack Sparrow

Director: Gore Verbinski

Genres: Adventure, Action, Fantasy

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Keira Knightley

Orlando Bloom

Jonathan Pryce

Naomie Harris

Geoffrey Rush

Jack Davenport

Awards: MTV Movie & T.V. Award for Best Comedic Performance

Movie Trailer: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World’s End (2007)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3W6S5BI” watchon=”Amazon”]

30. Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (2007)

Benjamin Barker, a barber, is wrongfully accused of a crime and imprisoned. On his return, he finds his wife dead, and his daughter is in the hands of corrupt judge Turnpin. Angered by the injustice, he adopts the new identity as Sweeney Todd, reopens his barbershop, and murders his customers using a straight razor with Mrs. Lovett’s assistance.

Role: Sweeney Todd

Director: Tim Burton

Genres: Drama, Thriller, Horror, Musical

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Alan Rickman

Helena Bonham Carter

Sacha Baron Cohen

Timothy Spall

Awards:

Golden Globe Award: Best Performance by an Actor in a Motion Picture – Comedy or Musical

MTV Movie & T.V. Award: Best Villain

Movie Trailer: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (2007)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3uYztIo” watchon=”Amazon”]

31. Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man’s Chest (2006)

In the second row of the Pirates of the Caribbean film series, Captain Jack Sparrow realizes he owes Davy Jones a blood debt and must recover his heart to redeem himself. In between, Will Turner and Elizabeth Swann must either obtain Jack’s mystical compass or face death. As a result, they accompany Jack on yet another insane adventure.

Role: Jack Sparrow

Director: Gore Verbinski

Genres: Action, Fantasy, Adventure

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Keira Knightley

Naomie Harris

Orlando Bloom

Jack Davenport

Jonathan Pryce

Bill Nighy

Awards:

MTV Movie & TV Award for Best Performance

People’s Choice Award for Favorite On-Screen Match-Up

Movie Trailer: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man’s Chest (2006)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3WcGSzW” watchon=”Amazon”]

32. Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (2005)

Willy Wonka, the eccentric candy creator, hides five golden tickets in random chocolate bars, which will offer five children a rare tour of his incredible chocolate factory. A young boy named Charlie wins the fifth ticket in a big rush and is accompanied by his grandfather on this once-in-a-lifetime experience that will transform his life forever.

Role: Willy Wonka

Director: Tim Burton

Genres: Comedy, Family, Adventure, Fantasy

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Helena Bonham Carter

AnnaSophia Robb

Missi Pyle

Noah Taylor

Christopher Lee

Freddie Highmore

David Kelly

Deep Roy

Movie Trailer: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (2005)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3G0ZIEi” watchon=”Amazon”]

33. Finding Neverland (2004)

Finding Neverland is a beautiful story of J.M. Barrie and the circumstances in his life that led to his most famous work, Peter Pan. Barrie develops a deep platonic friendship with Sylvia Llewelyn Davies, recently widowed, and becomes close to her four boys, Peter, George, Jack, and Michael. They served as his inspiration for Peter Pan.

Role: Sir James Matthew Barrie

Director: Marc Forster

Genres: Biography, Family, Drama

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Dustin Hoffman

Kate Winslet

Julie Christie

Radha Mitchell

Movie Trailer: Finding Neverland (2004)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3YyrJu0″ watchon=”Amazon”]

34. Ils se marièrent et eurent beaucoup d’enfants / Happily Ever After (2004)

Three middle-aged Frenchmen are struggling with their romantic life. First, Vincent (Yvan Attal) was unfaithful to his wife, Gabrielle (Charlotte Gainsbourg), who is considering having an affair with a man (Johnny Depp) she meets in a record store. Second, Georges (Alain Chabat) is fed up with his bossy and combative wife, Nathalie (Emmanuelle Seigner), but he can’t leave her. Third, Fred (Alain Cohen), a long-term bachelor, is unexpectedly exploring monogamy.

Role: L’inconnu

Director: Yvan Attal

Genres: Drama, Comedy, Music

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Charlotte Gainsbourg

Emmanuelle Seigner

Sébastien Vidal

Yvan Attal

Chloé Combret

Movie Trailer: Ils se marièrent et eurent beaucoup d’enfants / Happily Ever After (2004)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3FZ0zFD” watchon=”Amazon”]

35. Secret Window (2004)

Based on Stephen King’s story, Secret Window follows the life of a successful author. Mort Rainey, a writer, returns to his lakeside cabin after a devastating betrayal. Rainey tries to prove him incorrect when a scary man, John Shooter, appears to accuse him of plagiarism and follows him. However, strange occurrences around him compel Rainey to investigate the mystery.

Role: Mort Rainey

Director: David Koepp

Genres: Thriller, Mystery

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Maria Bello

Len Cariou

John Turturro

Timothy Hutton

Charles S. Dutton

Movie Trailer: Secret Window (2004)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3BKa09f” watchon=”Amazon”]

36. The Libertine (2004)

John Wilmot, famous as the Earl of Rochester, is a 17th-century poet with a tumultuous history. When Charles II assigns him the duty of creating a play for the French envoy, he does his utmost to meet the demands.

Role: Rochester

Director: Laurence Dunmore

Genres: Drama, Romance

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Rupert Friend

Rosamund Pike

Johnny Vegas

John Malkovich

Paul Ritter

Stanley Townsend

Francesca Annis

Movie Trailer: The Libertine (2004)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3HNdz2i” watchon=”Amazon”]

37. Once Upon a Time in Mexico (2003)

Sands, a dishonest CIA official, hires El Mariachi to assassinate General Marquez, a Mexican army commander charged by drug lord Barillo with assassinating the Mexican President. Sands also employs FBI agent Ramrez and AFN operative Ajedrez to find and assassinate Barillo. Sands, on the other hand, has another plan.

Role: Sands

Director: Robert Rodriguez

Genres: Action, Thriller

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Antonio Banderas

Salma Hayek

Mickey Rourke

Eva Mendes

Danny Trejo

Enrique Iglesias

Willem Dafoe

Movie Trailer: Once Upon a Time in Mexico (2003)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3hznUEs” watchon=”Amazon”]

38. Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl (2003)

The cursed zombie crew of the Black Pearl attacks Port Royal, Jamaica, and kidnaps Governor’s daughter Elizabeth, who possesses a gold piece required to break the curse. Will Turner, a gallant blacksmith, frees eccentric pirate Jack Sparrow and urges him to join him in his heroic journey to save Elizabeth from the pirates.

Role: Jack Sparrow

Director: Gore Verbinski

Genres: Fantasy, Action, Adventure

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Orlando Bloom

Keira Knightley

Zoe Saldana

Jonathan Pryce

Geoffrey Rush

Awards:

MTV Movie & TV Award for Best Male Performance

Movie Trailer: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl (2003)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3YzizOe” watchon=”Amazon”]

39. Blow (2001)

Blow chronicles the story of cocaine smuggler George Jung, who saw his family financially struggle when he was young and resolved never to suffer in the same way. He becomes wealthy by dealing in marijuana and, eventually, cocaine. First, however, he will have to face the repercussions of his actions, which will be more than just legal implications.

Role: George Jung

Director: Ted Demme

Genres: Crime, Biography, Drama

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Ray Liotta

Emma Roberts

Penelope Cruz

Franka Potente

Rachel Griffiths

Movie Trailer: Blow (2001)

[Jwatchnow link=”https://amzn.to/3Yx9fdC” watchon=”Amazon”]

40. From Hell (2001)

Based on the graphic novel, From Hell revolves around the heinous Jack the Ripper killings. Inspector Frederick Abberline of Whitechapel Police Department races against time to stop the Ripper and save the prostitute Mary Kelly, whom he has fallen in love with while uncovering a sinister Freemason conspiracy.

Role: Inspector Frederick Abberline

Director: Albert Hughes, Allen Hughes

Genres: Horror, Mystery, Thriller

Main Cast:

Johnny Depp

Ian Holm

Heather Graham

Robbie Coltrane
